title: TikTok nears the endgame

last_post.content:
RT @ZoeSchiffer
Little scoop from me today: Twitter has been down-ranking the corporate accounts of its competitors, including 19 official TikTok accounts, 3 Snap accounts, and 2 Instagram accounts. This means their tweets won’t show on the For You tab for the most part: https://www.platformer.news/p/tiktok-nears-the-endgame

title: Just Because ChatBots Can’t Think Doesn’t Mean They Can’t Lie

last_post.content:
This superb article by @maria connects generative AI's tendency to make stuff up and present it as facts with Big Publishing's vile efforts to shut down libraries it can't control. https://www.thenation.com/article/culture/internet-archive-publishers-lawsuit-chatbot/

Read it, please, to understand how dangerous the publishers' lawsuit against the invaluable Internet Archive really is.

(Perhaps unsurprisingly, Big Journalism has mostly ignored what's at stake.)

title: On Making in the Digital Humanities

last_post.content:
It's lovely to see 'On Making in the Digital Humanities:
The scholarship of digital humanities development in honour of John Bradley' has been published (OA).

Edited by Julianne Nyhan, Geoffrey Rockwell, Stéfan Sinclair, and Alexandra Ortolja-Baird.

A special volume for so many reasons. I'm proud to have contributed to it, with Arianna Ciula from King's Digital Lab.

https://www.uclpress.co.uk/products/211148

#digitalhumanities

title: Life Without Light: Creatures in the Dark With Sarah McAnulty

last_post.content:
In the dark deep sea, sperm whales use echolocation to find food.

Their echolocation clicks are *loud*. 230 decibels loud. How loud is that? Well, loud enough that if a sound wave of 230 decibels hit ya, you'd be dead 😳

Want to learn more about how animals live in the dark?
👀

You do?? Well you're in luck because I'm teaching a class this summer starting June 20th that's all about Life in the Dark.

I'm rabies vaccinated. Let's go.

4 weeks, $75
https://www.atlasobscura.com/experiences/nocturnal-animals-course

title: Meta considers a new social network, as decentralized model gains steam

last_post.content:
You see this story by @NaomiNix of the Washington post?

It's not so important that Meta is "considering" a new social network.

The real story is "decentralized model gains steam".

And what is that "decentralized model"? The Fediverse!

The mainstream media is now acknowledging that the Fediverse is cutting edge social media technology.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/03/11/meta-mastodon-activitypub/

@fediversenews

title: GitHub - NouamaneTazi/bloomz.cpp: C++ implementation for BLOOM

last_post.content:
And now it's possible to run Bloom-7B1 on an M1 Pro, thanks to bloomz.cpp by Nouamane Tazi: https://github.com/NouamaneTazi/bloomz.cpp

Bloom is a fun model: it was training used Jean Zay Public Supercomputer, provided by the French government and powered using mostly nuclear energy

It's under the RAIL license which allows (limited) commercial use, unlike LLaMA

Lots more details here: https://huggingface.co/bigscience/bloom-7b1

title: One Fish, Two Fish, Quiet Fish, Loud Fish

last_post.content: Today I learned that fish make incredibly loud, low frequency sounds. According to a researcher I spoke with, NOAA's Megan McKenna, they are kind of like frogs -- one will start yammering, then a ton of them will join into a chorus, and then it will die down. Here are some recordings! #science #fish #music https://sanctuaries.noaa.gov/news/mar21/calling-fish.html

title: Jonas Pelzer

last_post.content:
👋 I'm Jonas, a designer & developer. You can find my work at http://jonaspelzer.com.

My side projects include the website builder http://temper.one, the web design gallery http://collected.li, my type foundry http://jonastype.com, and the experimental poetry publication http://post-self-evident-poems.com.

I'm an associated researcher at @uclab_potsdam.

My work and research often revolve around topics such as communication, literature, visual culture, the web, and typography.

#introduction

title: 'The Wire' Star Lance Reddick Dead at 60

last_post.content:
We’ll miss you, Lance Reddick.

Iconic star of The Wire, John Wick, Lost, Fringe, the video games Destiny and Horizon Zero Dawn, and the face of countless other roles, TMZ reports (with Variety confirming) that legendary actor Lance Reddick has died at age 60.

No matter where you saw him or heard his voice, Reddick was always immediately recognizable and added a ton of weight to anything he appeared in. As a former Baltimore resident, I will always cherish his role as the sharp and upstanding Cedric Daniels.

https://www.tmz.com/2023/03/17/the-wire-star-lance-reddick-dead-dies/

title: Strife at eLife: inside a journal’s quest to upend science publishing

last_post.content:
I have, no word of a lie, had a paper rejected in part because one of the reviewers said I was using the wrong kind of hyphen.

The modern peer review process is extorted labor in service of gerontocratic gatekeeping and market capture and it can burn.

title: cnn.com/2023/03/17/politics/de...

last_post.content:
The same week that some people are telling you that OBVIOUSLY “woke” has a clear meaning, and that only disingenuous people would argue otherwise, the 11th Circuit refused to stay the trial court ruling that Florida’s “dystopian” Stop WOKE Act violated the First Amendment.

Don’t piss on my leg and tell me it’s raining.

https://www.cnn.com/2023/03/17/politics/desantis-anti-woke-law-appeal-block/index.html

title: Stack Overflow Examples

last_post.content:
ivs 0.2.0 is on CRAN! #rstats

ivs is a specialized package for working with intervals (think merging overlapping date ranges).

This release brings a number of new functions and a new vignette listing Stack Overflow questions that I've answered using the package!

https://davisvaughan.github.io/ivs/articles/examples.html

https://davisvaughan.github.io/ivs/news/index.html#ivs-020

title: Technical Ramblings  » Blog Archive   » VSI Curl Support

last_post.content: As I remember it, 2010 was the year that "cloud-optimized" GeoTIFF began. Christopher Schmidt blogged about it then: https://crschmidt.net/blog/archives/425/vsi-curl-support/. That's 4 years before the story told in https://radiant.earth/blog/2023/03/the-naive-origins-of-the-cloud-optimized-geotiff/ begins.

title: New to the ShinyUiEditor: bslib Cards!

last_post.content:
The latest update of {shinyuieditor} is an exciting one. The biggest addition is the new flexible card component from {bslib}. There is also a new text component and plenty of bug fixes! (1/4)
Blog version of thread: https://shiny.rstudio.com/blog/cards-in-shinyuieditor.html

title: WordPress and the fediverse

last_post.content:
Automattic, the company behind WordPress is now the official author of the ActivityPub plugin. This is pretty big news, since it allows every WordPress website to be a potential fediverse server.

In this piece I take a look at the potential impact on #fediverse culture, zooming in on how tagging your WordPress posts makes them show up when you search for a specific hashtag here on the fediverse.

How do you think this will change the fediverse?

@fediversenews
Read at: https://fediversereport.com/wordpress-on-the-fediverse/

last_post.content:
